identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of RIST4721 Versus Placebo in Subjects with Moderate to Severe PPP
identificationModule.officialTitle: Phase 2a, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study Investigating RIST4721 Versus Placebo in Subjects with Moderate to Severe PPP

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study assesses the efficacy and safety of RIST4721 compared to a placebo in adult subjects suffering from moderate to severe Palmoplantar Pustulosis (PPP). PPP is a chronic inflammatory skin condition characterized by neutrophil infiltration. RIST4721 is a potent CXCR2 antagonist designed to block neutrophil influx to sites of inflammation. The trial involves a 4-week, double-blind treatment period to determine if the drug can effectively reduce pustule counts and improve disease severity symptoms compared to the placebo.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This phase 2a, multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study investigated the oral administration of RIST4721 versus placebo in subjects with moderate to severe Palmoplantar Pustulosis (PPP). The study was conducted at sites in Canada and Germany. Key eligibility criteria included a history of PPP for at least 6 months, a Palmoplantar Pustulosis Area and Severity Index (PPPASI) ≥ 8, and a Palmoplantar Pustulosis Physician Global Assessment (PPPGA) ≥ 3. 

Eligible subjects were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to receive either RIST4721 300 mg or placebo solution orally once daily for 28 days. The study duration included an up to 30-day screening period, a 28-day treatment period, and a 14-day follow-up period. The primary efficacy endpoints were the relative change from baseline in fresh and total pustule counts at day 28. Secondary and exploratory endpoints included absolute change from baseline in pustule counts, the proportion of subjects achieving at least a 50% reduction in pustule counts, changes in PPPASI, Palmoplantar Pustulosis Severity Index (PPSI), pain visual analogue scale (VAS), and Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI). Safety assessments included monitoring of adverse events, vital signs, electrocardiograms, and clinical laboratory tests, specifically looking at absolute neutrophil counts (ANC) and pharmacokinetics.

armGroups.label: RIST4721
armGroups.description: Subjects received RIST4721 300 mg solution orally once daily for 28 days.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Subjects received placebo solution orally once daily for 28 days.

interventions.name: RIST4721
interventions.description: 300 mg solution administered orally once daily.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Relative change from baseline in fresh pustule count
primaryOutcomes.description: Fresh pustules were defined as macroscopically visible pustules that were white/yellow in color with no brown color, with or without crust, and present on the glabrous skin of the palms and/or soles.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Relative change from baseline in total pustule count
primaryOutcomes.description: Assessment of the total number of pustules on the palms and soles.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Absolute change from baseline in fresh pustule count
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured as the absolute difference in pustule count compared to baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Absolute change from baseline in total pustule count
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured as the absolute difference in pustule count compared to baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving at least a 50% reduction in fresh pustule count
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants achieving a ≥ 50% reduction from baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving at least a 50% reduction in total pustule count
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants achieving a ≥ 50% reduction from baseline.

otherOutcomes.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving at least a 50% reduction in PPPASI (PPPASI-50)
otherOutcomes.description: Palmoplantar Pustulosis Psoriasis Area and Score Index (PPPASI) 50% reduction response rate.

otherOutcomes.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving at least a 50% reduction in PPSI
otherOutcomes.description: Palmoplantar Pustulosis Severity Index (PPSI) 50% reduction response rate.
Pharmacokinetic assessment of RIST4721 plasma concentrations.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in Palmoplantar Pustulosis Psoriasis Area and Score Index (PPPASI)
Change from baseline in Palmoplantar Pustulosis Physician Global Assessment (PPPGA)
otherOutcomes.description: Physician's global assessment of disease severity.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in Palmoplantar Pustulosis Severity Index (PPSI)
otherOutcomes.description: Assessment involving subscores of erythema, pustules, and desquamation.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in Pain Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
Change from baseline in Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)

otherOutcomes.description: Safety assessment including physical examinations, vital signs, electrocardiograms, and clinical laboratory tests.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: From randomization through the 14-day follow-up period (Day 42)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
* Subjects 18–70 years of age
* ≥ 6-month history of PPP as defined by the presence of pustules on palms and/or soles, but without evidence of infection
* Moderate or severe PPP as defined by Palmoplantar Pustulosis Psoriasis Area and Score Index (PPPASI) ≥ 8 and Palmoplantar Pustulosis Physician Global Assessment (PPPGA) ≥ 3 at day-1 (day prior to study drug administration)
* Minimum of 8 fresh pustules at screening and 20 fresh pustules at day-1
